speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe what happened just before you lost consciousness?

speaker: Patient
text: "I remember going to the bathroom, and I was doing my business, and then I just... everything went black. I don't know, it was like my body just gave out on me, I guess."

speaker: Doctor
text: Did you experience any dizziness or visual disturbances right before losing consciousness?

speaker: Patient
text: "No, nothing like that. I didn't feel dizzy or anything like that. I just... stopped being able to breathe, I suppose. My body just went limp, and I think I must have fallen to the ground."

speaker: Doctor
text: Did you have any recent head injuries or engage in any activities that could have caused a sudden impact? REQUEST TEST: Blood glucose level check.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you eaten anything lately or do you have any conditions like diabetes?

speaker: Patient
text: "Not that I can think of, no. I had breakfast a few hours ago, just some cereal and toast. And I'm pretty sure I'm healthy, I've never had any issues with my blood sugar levels or anything like that."

speaker: Doctor
text: Did you notice any changes in your environment or smell something unusual right before it happened?

speaker: Patient
text: "I didn't notice anything out of the ordinary, no unusual smells or anything like that. The bathroom was just the usual bathroom, you know, toilet, sink, toilet paper, that kind of thing."

speaker: Doctor
text: Did you feel nauseous or vomit shortly after losing consciousness? DIAGNOSIS READY: Hypoglycemia based on low blood glucose levels.
